events.name: Creating Marketing Homepages That Drive Results - 1 on 1 Tuition
events.description:
Creating Marketing Homepages That Drive Results 
1 on 1 / small group Web Site & Marketing Class
Design websites that drive results! In this 60-minute class, join Sam — a developer and digital marketer from a leading media agency — as he shares how to refine your creative process, capitalize on feedback, and use best practices to design a marketing site that leads to conversions for your company.
This class is perfect for freelancers, SME owners, real estate / insurance agents and everyone who wants to increase the effectiveness of their web design. Lessons include:
Defining the goals of the webpage Sketching with consideration for hierarchy and user patternsAdvanced usage of digital marketing to collect leadsBusiness funnel to increase your sales by 3x
It’s one thing to create designs that look amazing. It’s also your job to make sure those designs produce results –– and this class will teach you how to do just that!
FEES
1 on 1 is 60 dollars per hour
There is group discount, please contact me for more info*Side Note*Primary School Tutors will cost you over 50 dollars per hour just to teach your kids PSLE.
Imagine PSLE level tutors can command 50 dollars per hour, what's more for a class that can actually improve your income.
I sincerely believe this training can be far more valuable than any academic qualifications - this coming from a former teacher. It has the potential to be the best investment in education you have ever made, if you take action to apply what will be taught.
Whatsapp me

events.name: Blockchain Fundamentals Technical Reading - Smart Contract Security
events.description: Note: This is a meetup that requires knowledge of Computer Science. You will need to complete the readings listed below. Please also print your copies of the papers. Date: 14 June 2018 (Thu) Time:[masked]pm Location: Zilliqa Office @thebridge, #01-03 Ascent Building, 2 Science Park Drive, Singapore[masked](Next to Kent Ridge MRT) Agenda:6:30-7:00pm Presentation on Smart Contract Security by Aashish Kolluri7:00-7:45pm Breakout Discussion Groups - Session will break out into smaller discussion groups to go over papers critically with an eye to research extensions or critiques7:45-8:00pm Presentations and Sharing Readings:1) Finding The Greedy, Prodigal, and Suicidal Contracts at Scale, I Nikolic, A Kolluri, I Sergey, P Saxena, A Hoborhttps://arxiv.org/abs/1802.06038 2) ZEUS: Analyzing Safety of Smart Contracts, S Kalra, S Goel, M Dhawan, S Sharma, NDSShttp://wp.internetsociety.org/ndss/wp-content/uploads/sites/25/2018/02/ndss2018_09-1_Kalra_paper.pdf 3) Enter the Hydra: Towards Principled Bug Bounties and Exploit-Resistant Smart Contracts, L Breidenbach, P Daian, F Tramer, A Juelshttp://www.comp.nus.edu.sg/~prateeks/papers/BWH.pdf This event is brought to you in collaboration with NUS, Zilliqa and TheBridge.
events.location: thebridge, a coworking platform by Ascendas-Singbridge, Level 1, Ascent, 2 Science Park Drive, Singapore 118222

events.name: Book Club: Challenges for Game Designers
events.description: Book club returns by popular demand ;) After the previous hardcore machine learning course, we are going to switch gears to read about game design: Challenges for Game Designers, by Brenda Brathwaite. You can get the book from Amazon: https://www.amazon.com/Challenges-Game-Designers-Brenda-Brathwaite/dp/158450580X/ We are meeting weekly, covering 2 topics (about 20-40 pages) per week. Same format as previous book club meetups: - Doors open 7pm. Meetup starts 7:30pm and usually runs to 9:00/9:30pm.- Bring dinner/snacks and/or eat beforehand.- Everyone who participates is expected to read the week's chapters beforehand.- We go around the room and everybody talks about one thing you find interesting and/or ask a question regarding the chapters read. Below is a list of all the topics we plan to cover: Week 1:The BasicsGame Design Atoms Week 2:Puzzle DesignConverting Digital to Physical Week 3:Elements of ChanceElements of "Strategic" Skill Week 4:Elements of "Twitch" SkillChance and Skill: Finding the Balance Week 5:Targeting a MarketLearning an Unfamiliar Genre Week 6:Designing a Game to Tell a StoryAdding and Subtracting Mechanics Week 7:"But Make It Multiplayer"Creating a User Interface Week 8:Games as ArtGames as a Teaching Tool Week 9Serious GamesCasual GamesSocial Networks and Games
events.location: Tim and Wei's Residence, #06-160, 9 Boon Keng Road, Singapore

events.description: Hi friends! We're thrilled to have our next Serverless Singapore meetup in June. Thank you to Google Singapore for sponsoring this event. --- Programme 7:00pm: Doors open 7:10pm: Start of session, opening address by hosts 7:20pm: Start of scheduled talks 9:00pm: Community announcements / End of event --- Scheduled Talks • 'A Brief Introduction to Serverless' by Yos Riady • 'How Serverless Helps Startups Innovate and Scale' by Gabe Hollombe

events.name: Introduction to WordPress (W2) - For SMEs/Property Agents/Web Designers
events.description:
Introduction to WordPress (W series) - For SMEs/Property Agents/Web Designers
This is a free introductory course for those who are interested to find out more about WordPress. This is a basic introductory course, so this is not for you if you already have experience using WordPress.

Course Criteria
If you are…


A web designer or web developer interested to start building WordPress websites


a WordPress website owner and want to learn how to maintain it


a WordPress.com blogger and want to find out how to maximise it


a business owner/property agent who desires a simple way to create and manage your own budget website


Looking to revamp your own website with something more dynamic


Exploring WordPress courses to attend, but not sure if you are ready for it



Course Outline


What is a CMS? What is WordPress? WordPress.com vs WordPress.org


Why WordPress? The Pros and Cons of Using WordPress


What do you need to install WordPress?


How does WordPress work? Posts & Pages; Themes & Plugins


Maintaining & Updating WordPress



Course Format
Each class has a maximum of 10 people, and group discussions are frequently held throughout the session. You are recommended to bring your own laptops as you will be given an opportunity to practise using WordPress during the course.

Course Fee
This is meant to be a free introductory session. At no point before, during or after this course will we collect a fee for your participation in this course. Light snacks and drinks will be provided.

Other Notes
This course will start and end on time. Please notify Oangle if you are unable to make it. This class will only go ahead if there are at least 4 participants. You will be notified in case of cancellation by 1PM on the day of the course.

Please feel free to contact Oangle if you have any questions about this course.
